page.title: 13BRAFFORD'S FARM CROPS.
page.content: On Brafford's Farm there are two hundred and sevety seven acres of arable land. The farmer grows winter barley, winter wheat, potatoes, oil seed rape and peas. The winter wheat, winter barley and oil seed rape are all drilled in September and harvested in July. The potatoes are drilled in April and harvested in October. The farmer grows peas for Bird's Eye, who like tender garden peas the best. The peas are vined by a viner. The viner picks the peas and then splits out the pods. The empty pods and any other waste go down a shute and come out at the back of the viner. The peas are stored in a tank in the viner. When the tank is full, the peas are emptied into lorries and trailers and taken to the factory.
